body.p:
To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramblett
Gov. of Kentucky
Your petitioners would represent that John Stewart was fined fifty dollars by the Judgement of the Bath Circuit Court for the offense of a Breach of the Peace

Mr Stewart is an orderly man and in this instance was found in bad company He is a poor man with a family to support. In these troublesome times it is difficult to get along in a community When guerilla raids are frequent
We ask Your Excellency to interpose and remit the fine against Mr Stewart This 12th Decr 1863
